settings.title: Hydration and recovery
settings.content: With 5g of Creatine for muscle energy and strength, alongside a perfect blend of Sodium, Potassium, and Magnesium, your hydration and recovery are set from the moment you wake up.

settings.title: Mental Clarity and focus
settings.content: 1000mg L-tyrosine, 150mg Alpha GPC, and 50mcg Huperzine A work synergistically to enhance cognitive function, improving focus, memory, and mental clarity.

settings.title: Enhanced Blood Flow and Performance
settings.content: With 9g L-citrulline, Morning Would supports increased blood flow, boosting nutrient delivery and enhancing physical performance.

settings.title: Muscle support and endurance
settings.content: The inclusion of EAAs (Essential Amino Acids), 5g Glutamine, and 2g Betaine Anhydrous supports muscle repair, growth, and endurance, ensuring you're physically as sharp as you are mentally.

settings.title: Electrolytes
settings.text: The perfect blend of Sodium (200mg), Potassium (200mg), and Magnesium (80mg), your hydration and recovery are set from the moment you wake up.

settings.title: L-Citrulline
settings.text: L- citrulline is an amino acid that plays an important role in the body's nitrogen and urea cycle, which helps remove ammonia, a waste product of protein metabolism, from the body. One of its key functions is its involvement in the production of nitric oxide (NO), a molecule that helps relax blood vessels and improve blood flow.

settings.title: Creatine
settings.text:
Supplementing with creatine has been shown to increase muscle creatine stores, leading to improvements in strength, power, and muscle mass. Additionally, creatine may enhance exercise performance, especially during activities that involve short bursts of high-intensity effort, such as weightlifting or sprinting.

Moreover, research suggests that creatine supplementation may have other potential benefits, including improved cognitive function, protection against neurological diseases, and enhanced recovery from exercise.

settings.title: L-Glutamine
settings.text:
It's one of the most abundant amino acids in the bloodstream and plays several important roles in various bodily functions.

Firstly, L-glutamine is a primary source of energy for cells in the intestines and immune system. It helps maintain the integrity of the intestinal lining and supports the function of immune cells, which are crucial for fighting off infections and maintaining overall health.

settings.title: Betaine Anhydrous
settings.text: Some research suggests that Betaine Anhydrous supplementation might help improve exercise performance. It's thought to do this by supporting methylation processes in the body, which may help reduce fatigue and increase strength and power output during exercise.

settings.title: L-Tyrosine
settings.text: L-tyrosine is an amino acid that serves several important functions in the body. It's a precursor for the production of neurotransmitters such as dopamine, norepinephrine, and epinephrine, which play crucial roles in mood regulation, stress response, and cognitive function. Additionally, L-tyrosine is involved in the synthesis of thyroid hormones, which regulate metabolism and energy production.

settings.title: L-Histidine HCl
settings.text: It's essential for many functions in our bodies, including helping us grow, repairing tissues, and to support muscle growth or improve digestion.

settings.title: L-Lysine
settings.text: One of the key roles of L-lysine is its involvement in the formation of collagen, a protein that provides structure and support to tissues such as skin, bones, and cartilage. L-lysine also plays a role in calcium absorption and collagen formation, which is important for bone health.

settings.title: L-Threonine
settings.text:
L-Threonine is involved in the production of neurotransmitters and immunoglobulins, supporting nervous system function and immune response, respectively.

In essence, L-Threonine's multifaceted roles underscore its significance in maintaining overall health and physiological function.

settings.title: L-Tryptophan
settings.text: L-tryptophan is an amino acid, kind of like a building block for proteins, that plays a crucial role in our body's chemistry. It's essential because our body uses it to make two important chemicals: serotonin and melatonin. So, in essence, L-tryptophan is a vital component that contributes to our overall well-being by helping regulate mood and sleep.

settings.title: L-Methionine
settings.text: L-methionine is like a Lego piece that the body needs to build different important things. One thing it helps build is proteins, which are like the building blocks of our body. It's also important for making other special molecules that help with different jobs inside our body.

settings.title: L-Phenylalanine
settings.text: L-phenylalanine is a special ingredient our body needs to make neurotransmitters. Think of neurotransmitters as messengers that help our brain communicate with the rest of our body. These messengers control our mood, how we think, and how we feel. So, L-phenylalanine is kind of like a superhero ingredient that helps our body stay happy, think clearly, and work properly.

settings.title: Alpha GPC
settings.text: Supplementing with Alpha GPC may help increase levels of acetylcholine in the brain, which can potentially enhance cognitive function. Some studies suggest that Alpha GPC supplementation may improve memory, attention, and overall cognitive performance, particularly in older adults or individuals with cognitive decline.

settings.title: Huperzine A
settings.text: Studies suggest that Huperzine A supplementation may improve memory, learning, and overall cognitive function, particularly in individuals with cognitive decline or disorders such as Alzheimer's disease. It's also been investigated for its potential neuroprotective effects, meaning it may help protect brain cells from damage and degeneration.

settings.heading: Only The Highest Quality Ingredients
settings.text: We carefully chose ingredients that would have the best effect and at the proper doses. We have nothing to hide. No BS proprietary blends.

settings.heading: Why Morning Would Crushes The Competition
settings.text: Morning Would was crafted to deliver a sustained enhancement in energy, cognitive function, and rehydration, going past a temporary bump from caffeine.
